docs.abstract: After the harassment-related departures of executives and hosts, there was a spike in FoxNews.com articles on female teachers abusing students.
docs.snippet: After the harassment-related departures of executives and hosts, there was a spike in FoxNews.com articles on female teachers abusing students.
docs.lead_paragraph: In November, there was the story of a 22-year-old science teacher arrested in Oklahoma for her “sex romp” with a male student. In September, an article told of a 38-year-old teacher who kissed a student and let him “touch her breasts behind Culver’s,” a burger joint in Kerrville, Tex. And in July there was a report on a 54-year-old music teacher in Georgia who, a headline announced, “blames male student, 17, for tricking her into having sex ‘like a used-car salesman.’”

headline.main: At the Fox News Site, a Sudden Focus on Women as Sex Offenders
headline.print_headline: Fox Website Puts Focus On Women As Abusers

docs.abstract: Companies are expected to report billions of dollars in short-term losses stemming from the new tax law. But they are a prelude to much larger profits.
docs.snippet: Companies are expected to report billions of dollars in short-term losses stemming from the new tax law. But they are a prelude to much larger profits.
docs.lead_paragraph: It will sound like bad news.

headline.main: Companies Warn of Hits From Tax Cuts. Don’t Be Fooled.
headline.print_headline: Warnings On Losses Sound Dire. They’re Not.

docs.abstract: The investment in Propagate, which created the first original series for Apple and Twitter, is a bet on new content for a changing media landscape.
docs.snippet: The investment in Propagate, which created the first original series for Apple and Twitter, is a bet on new content for a changing media landscape.
docs.lead_paragraph: Since its inception eight years ago, the Raine Group has sought to invest in promising new content providers.

headline.main: Raine Takes a Stake in ‘Planet of the Apps’ Creator
headline.print_headline: Merchant Bank Buys Into ‘Planet of the Apps’ Creator

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: The Freedom of the Press Foundation will make copies of content from sites that it thinks are at risk of being defanged by wealthy buyers.
docs.snippet: The Freedom of the Press Foundation will make copies of content from sites that it thinks are at risk of being defanged by wealthy buyers.
docs.lead_paragraph: An exposé of Silk Road, the underground drug market.

headline.main: Saving Gawker and Alt-Weeklies From Deletion
headline.print_headline: Archiving Gawker and Others to Address ‘Billionaire Problem’

docs.abstract: Mr. Liveris had served as the chief executive of Dow Chemical since 2004 and led a deal to combine it with its rival DuPont.
docs.snippet: Mr. Liveris had served as the chief executive of Dow Chemical since 2004 and led a deal to combine it with its rival DuPont.
docs.lead_paragraph: Andrew Liveris will step down as executive chairman of DowDuPont in April, less than a year after completing a merger that created what is now one of the world’s largest chemicals companies, DowDuPont said on Monday.

headline.main: Andrew Liveris to Step Down as DowDuPont’s Executive Chairman
headline.print_headline: Executive Chairman of DowDuPont to Step Down Ahead of Planned Split

docs.abstract: In-dash navigation systems aren’t as nimble as their smartphone counterparts. But as cars get more complicated, built-in could mean better.
docs.snippet: In-dash navigation systems aren’t as nimble as their smartphone counterparts. But as cars get more complicated, built-in could mean better.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do you get someone to pay hundreds of dollars for an inferior product, when most people already have a better one in their pocket?

headline.main: Car Navigation Systems Plot a Course Forward Against Phone Apps
headline.print_headline: Smartphone Apps Chart a Course for Carmakers

docs.abstract: Jonah Bromwich, a breaking news reporter at The Times, uses an arsenal of social media tools to catch the latest tweets, posts and comments to discern their patterns.
docs.snippet: Jonah Bromwich, a breaking news reporter at The Times, uses an arsenal of social media tools to catch the latest tweets, posts and comments to discern their patterns.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Jonah Bromwich, a breaking news reporter for The Times in New York, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: How to Stay on Top of Breaking News
headline.print_headline: Tools for Staying on Top of Breaking News

docs.abstract: Porsche’s Mission E models will compete with Tesla’s Model S and Model X, but the German automaker isn’t focused just on high-performance vehicles. It’s getting into charging, too.
docs.snippet: Porsche’s Mission E models will compete with Tesla’s Model S and Model X, but the German automaker isn’t focused just on high-performance vehicles. It’s getting into charging, too.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tesla has practically had the market for pavement-scorching long-range electric vehicles all to itself. But consumers will soon have a lot more choices to compare with the Model S sedan and its sport-utility sibling, the Model X. And those offerings will be coming from established luxury brands that will be able to take advantage of tax breaks, just as they start to run out for the segment’s dominant brand.

headline.main: Porsche Positions Itself Against Tesla, on the Road and Beside It
headline.print_headline: Luxury Carmakers Position Themselves to Take On Tesla

docs.abstract: Seven Twitter users filed suit after they were blocked by President Trump’s account. At a hearing on Thursday, the main topic was the nature of Twitter.
docs.snippet: Seven Twitter users filed suit after they were blocked by President Trump’s account. At a hearing on Thursday, the main topic was the nature of Twitter.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan had plenty of questions for lawyers representing a group of Twitter users who sued President Trump in July after he blocked them on the social media service. And she had even more for the government.

headline.main: Judge Floats Idea to Settle @realDonaldTrump Twitter Blocking Case
headline.print_headline: Twitter Users Go to Court To Challenge Trump Block

docs.abstract: The state mandate, to take effect in 2020, is the first in the country and is expected to add $8,000 to $12,000 to the cost of a house.
docs.snippet: The state mandate, to take effect in 2020, is the first in the country and is expected to add $8,000 to $12,000 to the cost of a house.
docs.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — Long a leader and trendsetter in its clean-energy goals, California took a giant step on Wednesday, becoming the first state to require all new homes to have solar power.

headline.main: California Will Require Solar Power for New Homes
headline.print_headline: Solar Power to Be Required For New Homes in California
